title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1.1 EQUITABLE SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: Output 2.1.1. By end 2016, in coordination with national Government, district and local authorities in at least 23 municipalities, provide for a continuum of quality, basic and guaranteed social services, which contributes to Child Health, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Childhood Development, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning Outcomes, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2.1 Equit. Access to Quality Services by 2016 with the focus on the most vulnerable groups in specifically targeted areas, more women, girls and boys have access to and use a continuum of integrated social services, including sanitation services

Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Public finance management for child protection
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

title.narrative: Output 2.1.1. By end 2016, in coordination with national Government, district and local authorities in at least 23 municipalities,provide for a continuum of quality, basic and guaranteed social services

description.narrative: 'Grass-root' social protection and local governance activities have been completed in 2015 and evaluated. The results and lessons learnt were reviewed at concluding district round-table meetings and final conference in the South. Certain policy-level follow up action points were transferred to OUTPUT 1.2.2 | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/08/2016

title.narrative: of municipalities out of 23 that implement and monitor referral mechanism of social cash transfer administration and social services delivery
of municipalities out of 23 which have increased coverage of eligible children and families with social cash transfers
